inn1.comm: four of the them straight away, back of a length and wide enough of off stump to carve backward of point
straighter line and just blocked to point
fuller length a foot wide of off stump, left alone
same length, straighter line, Jayawardene forward to block back to the bowler
tad fuller and pressed pleasantly into the covers, placed well between mid-off and extra-cover
not quite as full, Jayawardene pokes from the crease and gets a thick inside edge to midwicket
length on the stumps, flicked wide of midwicket for a quick single
touch short and a pulled away in front of long leg, lovely timing
fuller sliding across the right-hander who runs this out to point
straighter line and knocked back up the wicket having initially looked to drop it towards midwicket
fuller length defended on the front foot back to the bowler
drops short again and once more pulled for four wide of long leg
full at the stumps, pressed steadily to mid-on
touch shorter, this nudged to short midwicket who's come from second slip
a yorker! Good grief. Dug out to mid-on
not quite a yorker this time, nudged up to mid-off
touch short and Dilshan rocks back to pull over midwicket, a decent thwack and four more
full at the stumps and pressed only as far as mid-off
full, a touch wide of off stump, cracked square and a half-save by a diving backward point, saved a certain boundary

slightly shorter length, played firmly at and take a thick outside edge that flies past the diving Jordan at wide slip. Regulation catch to second slip but Jordan is wider with only one slip in there, he dived to his left hand side but couldn't get there
similar area, this time carefully steered down to third man
length around off stump, Dilshan trying to stay leg side of it to play on the off side but gets a thick inside edge that goes nowhere
touch fuller, pressed wide enough of mid-off for a quick single
full, driven steadily only as far as extra-cover
good length on the off stump, pressed forward and angled down to third man
similar length, touch straighter and popped in front of square leg for a quick single
touch shorter and straighter, strikes the thigh pad with Dilshan looking to leg glance
fuller length, flicked in the air but through a vacant square leg area out to the deep fielder
full on the stumps again, deep square is down at long leg for Jaywardene and this is flicked into the gap, lovely little flick
drags the length back slightly on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
back of a length, goes to pull, gets hit and it almost bounces back onto the stumps, Dilshan aware enough to bat the ball away from leg stump
fuller length, driven without timing into extra-cover
shorter length, might come back at Dilshan a little shaping to play on the off side, he jabs at it and gets a thick inside edge to fine leg, very unlucky for the bowler
now tries to pull a ball a touch short of a length and misses, not too far from the off stump that
steps right across the stumps and looks to tuck leg side, think it was a thick inside edge into the pads that saved Dilly
fuller on the stumps, driven firmly back to the bowler who sticks out a left hand to save
around the wicket, swept off the stumps to deep-backward square leg
back clipping up the wicket not past the bowler
touch quicker, nudged off the stumps to short extra
down the track and whacks it over mid-off, no-one out on the off side and this is well picked up, playing in-to-out to find the off side gap
down again, leg side this time, again not perfectly timed but enough club to clear the in-field and it runs down to the long-on rope
another one, this time Dilshan nails the timing and strokes it over the long-on rope, top batting
full a foot wide of off stump, absolutely creamed on the drive but straight at cover, it landed just short of the fielder
just pushes at this gently and gets a run just past cover's right hand
straighter on a length, nudged to short long leg
fuller and more off stump, driven back to the bowler on the bounce
fuller on the leg stump, hit on the pad looking to flick leg side and they get a leg bye through square leg

short of a length, pulled and picks out long leg! What a poor way for Jaywardene to finish. It wasn't that short and was just helped on it's way into the leg side but he couldn't keep it down and it flew straight to long leg who pouched an easy catch. Jayawardene takes a slow walk off and gets a rapturous reception
good length at the off stump, nudged from the crease to point
good length sliding across Sangakkara who leaves
length on the stumps, worked wide of midwicket for an easy single in the end
full length nicely driven up the ground, Moeen across quickly to his left to slide and save at least one run
good length just outside off, punched firmly to mid-off, right off the meat of the bat
touch wider and beautifully steered in front of point, waited for and timed so well
full length on the stumps, driven up to mid-off
tries to come more forward to this and flick leg side, finds mid-on
good length sliding across Dilshan who plays inside the line
short and pulled straight to short long leg, got away with that did Gurney
poor line with long leg up in the circle, this is tickled down to fine leg
length at the middle and leg stumps, clipped to square leg
around the wicket on the stumps, pressed back to the bowler
down the track and clipped down to long-on
over the wicket on the stumps, clipped from a full length to midwicket
fuller length, knocked firmly down to long-on
back around, full length driven down to long-off
a shimmy down to the pitch of the ball, worked out to deep midwicket
short and wide, cut firmly but straight to backward point
tighter line, slightly fuller length, played with the angle into midwicket
touch fuller, Dilshan from the crease trying to guide it away on the off side gets a thick inside edge to Buttler's left and they get a single
full length a foot wide of off stump, firm press forward blocking to cover
fuller ball, waited for an ran out to backward point
full on the leg stump, flicked firmly out to deep square
floated up just outside off stump, rolled steadily down to long-off
length ball, Dilshan hangs back and flicks with the angle out to deep midwicket
a step down working this from off stump to midwicket
touch short, back and cut firmly but Jordan gets down very quickly at a short cover point position to save, great work
fuller and just blocked back to the bowler
shimmies down again but can only nudge this to midwicket once more
waited for and cracked hard on the bounce over a leaping point, Hales has to scramble across from deep cover and does very well to save the boundary
fuller and slapped hard straight to Hales at deep cover this time
tight off stump line, good length, tried to drops this down to third man but got it only as far as slip
full just outside off, driven without perfect timing to the left of mid-on, fielder across quickly to save the run
full length again, another mistimed drive this straight to mid-off
length at the off stump, forward dropping this into point
full but a foot down leg
overcompensates and this is cracked from a foot and a half outside off through point, well struck
short-ish again but not quite as wide, only nudged to cover this time
straighter line and fuller, flicked to square leg
back working this back to the bowler
right out of his ground but flicking only as far as midwicket
stays in the crease this time and turns to square leg
full on middle, pushed firmly towards mid-on
picks off another boundary, a strong flowing cover drive this time as Jordan goes full and wide. Big stride and full swing of the arms from Sangakkara as he beats cover
now he's on the pads and gets clipped through straight midwicket
outside off, drives on the up and Taylor parries it in the covers this time, taking pace off the ball, and deep cover cleans up
full and straight, punched firmly to mid-on
full outside off, gets onto the front foot and slots it sweetly to cover
round the wicket, fraction short and wide, cut to backward point
this one slides on and takes a thick inside edge into the leg side
gets across outside off and flicks a full delivery down the ground
opens his stance and drives easily down to long off
tucked off the pads to deep square leg
goes back in the crease and flicks this behind square on the leg side...an over of milking
round the wicket, low full toss, eased down the ground
uses his feet and crunches it down to long on
lovely delivery! Nicely flighted, just outside off, grips and spins past the outside edge
driven out to short cover
played off the back foot to cover
leans forward and places it down the ground
full outside off, whipped along the ground to long on
round the wicket, tossed up at the stumps, pushed easily down the ground
dinked into the leg side, out to deep midwicket
comes forward, defended into the off side
uses his feet and whips down to long on from outside off
pushed into the off side, wanted the single but was sent back
tossed up on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
nifty footwork gets him to the pitch and he drives down to long off
cut into the off side
worked from outside to midwicket
a lovely, deft sweep from Sangakkara as Moeen drifts towards leg. Rolls his wrists on the ball and places it backward of square
short outside off, picks out backward point
knocked down the ground, along the floor, to long off
short outside, a punchy back-foot drive finds a gap in the covers and there's no one in the deep which means Jordan has to get his sprinting boots on
tighter to off stump, defended to cover
short outside off, opens the face off the back foot and places through point
takes this from outside off with a flick of the wrists, down to long on
nicely bowled, turn for Moeen and it nearly defeats Sangakkara as he uses his feet, aims to the leg side, and gets an outside edge to point
worked back to the bowler

would you believe it! The low full toss works. Sangakkara just swings it straight to midwicket. So both legends have given their wickets away. Another standing ovation as Sangakkara walks off. May not be his final innings in Sri Lanka, but will be his final ODI here
driven into the off side
flicked from outside off to the on side and Tredwell is able to get across
works the gap down to long this time
outside off, blocked
slightly shorter, worked off the back foot through midwicket
driven down to long off
hint of turn from outside off, takes the pad and bobbles down the pitch...tight over from Tredwell
full and dug out back to Moeen in his follow through
gets to the pitch and eases it down the ground
flicked out to midwicket
shuffles down the pitch outside off then a strong bottom-handed sends the ball through midwicket
goes for the cut and it slides off the top edge to short third man where Gurney makes a tumbling save, does well to cut off the boundary
worked down to long on
picks out midwicket
this time works from outside off to square leg
shorter on off stump, Mathews rocks backs and plays down to long on with a straight bat
fraction too short and Dilshan takes advantage as he goes onto the back foot and cracks in through the covers...there's no cover in the deep. Superb placement
worked off the pads to square leg
full outside off, driven square into the covers

big appeal for caught behind, given not out, and England review. Buttler was convinced. Not Hot Spot in this series. Very close, but not sure there will be conclusive evidence to overturn. And it stays not out. Front angle suggested a possible edge, but evidence had to be conclusive
worked to the leg side
flicked in the air but falls short of midwicket
uses his feet but can't it further than Moeen
dribbles towards Cook at square leg
ah, nicely played, goes down early and paddles this fine...Taylor runs around from deep square to keep them to a brace
full outside off, defended to the covers
comes down the pitch and carves it over backward point off a thick outside edge, runs quickly over the outfield buts gets hauled in near the boundary
full on off stump, punched to mid-off who is deep enough to allow the single
short of a length, angled into the pads, flicked to deep square leg
tucked off the body to short midwicket
back of a length on off stump, no width, defended into the covers
appeal for lbw, not a million miles away as Mathews gets a small stride forward and is taken on the front pad...perhaps spinning down the leg side, yep well past the stumps. Good spin, Moeen
brings out the revere sweep which he lofts high over backward point...touch of frustration being released in that shot
now he flicks along the ground through midwicket with the weighting to allow him back for a second
defended from outside off to the leg side
defended to midwicket
paddle-sweeps from outside off to deep square leg
full length on the stumps, flicked out to deep midwicket
similar length a foot outside off, driven at and get a bit of a thick edge to the left of third man

blocked off the back foot into the covers, Mathews wanted a run that was never there and is sent back, Root shies at the stumps, misses, and it runs out towards long leg for an overthrow to bring the 150 up
press forward and angles this length ball down to third man
slower ball on the stumps, seen and tucked into square leg
good length angled in at the pads, a huge cry for lbw but surely too high, the ball runs off behind point and they get a leg bye
paddle sweep off the stumps, bit of a top edge but safely away from square leg and down to deep backward square
forward pressing back up the wicket
comes down a step and flicks to the right of the bowler, Moeen slightly impeded unintentionally by the non-striker can't make the save
forward flicking to midwicket
floated up, meets this on the full and gentle paddles down to long leg

goes for another paddle sweep but it's a little quicker and flatter and skids onto leg stump! Moeen makes the breakthrough. Clever bowling. He'd been paddle swept a few times but pushed this through and Mathews got outside the line and when he missed he was praying for the ball to miss leg stump which it didn't
full at the off stump, driven off a thick inside edge wide of midwicket and they get a quick single
slip goes in, length on the off stump, defended back in the crease
similar length but a touch straighter and this is tucked wide of square leg, it barely runs out of the circle but they can charge back for a second with midwicket and long leg trying to get across
full on the off stump, forward is Chandimal pressing firmly up to mid-on
length ball a foot or so wide of off stump, driven with solid timing to cover
touch fuller and much straighter, nicely placed flick wide of the leg side sweeper and they get a second
forward pressing firmly to cover
more air, tries to work with the angle to leg and misses, would have slid down for the lbw
down to paddle sweep and does so successfully down to deep-backward square
forward turning a length ball to midwicket
forward playing leg side again, this tickled past leg slip and also wide of deep-backward square so they get a second
forward with a nudge up to mid-on
so is Dilly, flicking out to deep midwicket
floated up, sweep right off middle stump with the pad outside the line, did not want to miss that, gets it fine deep-backward square for another couple
and again, this time straight to the fielder
back playing firmly out to long-on
wide on the crease, very full, paddled off bang on middle this time, then Chandimal slipped going for the run
back punching down the ground for a single
full on the leg stump, flicked out to deep square leg
length on the off stump, played forward and gets a thick inside edge to the left hand of Buttler
fuller length, worked out into midwicket but the man from the deep is in quickly to save the second
decent length and straight again, whipped straight to midwicket
touch shorter, played from the crease up towards mid-on, they take on the fielder and get home easily, not the best fielding at all really
yorker length, dug out up the wicket
around the wicket, slower ball slips an inch or two down leg
another slower ball, this full and just outside off, played carefully to extra cover
fuller and driven past extra-cover this time, Cook goes back from mid-off
yorker on off stump, dug out back to the bowler
very full again, not quite the yorker and this is dug out into midwicket but Stokes - on as a sub - is in very quickly to save the second
misses the yorker this time and it ends up as a low full toss that Dilshan slaps down the ground with good enough force to get it inside long-on
another low full toss, swung powerfully into the covers and Taylor misfields and this will skip away for four more
back of length, tries to pull from outside off and misses

touch fuller, pulled again, takes a huge top edge down to third man, Gurney sprints in but totally misjudges it, it lands short of him and then also skids past him and almost into the rope, terrible fielding
another short ball, this pulled only as far as deep square
another ball to pull - which is okay with the fielders set back for the stroke - gets this in front of square and they get back for the second
very full but very down leg
full just outside off stump, driven up to mid-off
cutter that slips down leg again but it was so tight to the leg stump the umpire lets Woakes get away with it
length just outside off, Chandimal clears the front leg and heaves leg side, just clearing midwicket, enough bat on it to get it away to the fence
just back of a length around middle and off, Chandimal across his stumps clipping down to long leg and that brings the 200 up
touch shorter, pulled out to long leg, just helped around the corner
yorker length, dug out into midwicket
short slower ball drifts down leg as Chandimal misses with a pull stroke
very full, clipped out straight to deep square
slower ball full on the stumps, looking to flick leg side gets it to midwicket
very full at the off stump, dug out back to the bowler
clears the front leg and heaves a length ball into the leg side, only out to deep midwicket
drags his fingers across this, Dilly waits for it and then clips backward of deep square for a sharp couple, fifty stand in 48 balls
yorker on the stumps, dug out wide of mid-off and they get a comfortable short single
length ball on off stump, whacked with an almightly slap leg side straight to deep midwicket
very full on the stumps, clipped wide of mid-on this time for a sharp single
worked to midwicket
down the pitch, works this from outside off to the on side and it beats a diving Tredwell
down the pitch and a very strong shot over midwicket, which skims to the right of long-on
very full, worked off his toes to deep square and that's excellent running to make it into a second. Beating Jordan's strong arm
shorter in length, Chandimal again down the track and tucks into square leg
dabbed into the leg side, just to the right of midwicket so he keeps the strike
very full, dug out back to the bowler
swung down the ground to long off and he trots through, then signals to the dressing room
heaved from outside off through the leg side with a slog sweep
touch short, cut off the back foot to square cover and that takes Dilshan to 9000 ODI runs
just clears long on! Down the track, wasn't quite to the pitch but still went through with the shot and Jordan actually mistimed his jump and could have gone with two hands rather than one
along the ground to long on this time
round the wicket, full toss outside off, driven to long off
slower ball outside off, defeats Dilshan as he tries to guide this to vacant third man area
angled into Dilshan, dabbed down to short third man
another low full toss, flicked through midwicket where Stokes can't field cleanly but fortunately for him there is back-up behind him
full, worked straight down the pitch and beats Gurney
flicked from outside off out to deep midwicket to take him to 99 and he has the strike

there it is! Full outside off, driven through the covers and wide of the cover sweep. Comes back for the second with his arms raised, and removes his helmet. Takes in the applause. His 18th ODI hundred
good delivery, speared in full at leg stump, Dilshan can only jab it into the leg side and Jordan gets across

another full, another wicket! This was a horrid delivery, a slower ball which comes out as a high full toss and Dilshan swats it straight to Moeen at deep midwicket. Height looked an issue, but Dilshan was happy to walk off
full on off stump, pushed into the covers
short of a length, angled across outside off, opens the face down to third man
straight, low full toss, squeezed out to midwicket
flicked from off stump through midwicket and that's good running for the second
slower ball which is pushed down the leg side
handsomely driven through the off side, stand and deliver, although Taylor chases it down
short outside off stump, pulled through midwicket and it splits deep midwicket and long on
another slower ball, full, blocked to the off side
low full toss flicked down to long on...1000 ODI runs for Perera
round the wicket, angled into the pads, deflects wide of a diving Buttler and fine leg does the tidying up
short of a length outside off, takes the outside down to third man...he wasn't in complete control, but it was very safe with no slips in place
power! Short again, and this was a very authentic shot. Latched on with a rasping back-foot square drive which flies wide of the diving backward point
now he carves a full delivery through the off side, frees his arms and crashes it through the covers and beats the sweeper
short of a length, angled into Perera, pulled to deep square leg
full, straight, pushed down to long on
round the wicket, short of a length, tucked out to midwicket
over the wicket, back of a length on leg stump, worked into the leg side
full toss, Jordan is lucky to get away with it s it glances the pad through to Buttler
flicks a full delivery to midwicket and takes him to a 43-ball fifty, he's played very well today
gets a hint of with outside off which allows him to sythe it over the off side where there is no cover in the deep
short again, slower ball and another boundary, as he just waits a fraction long and flat-bats it over the cover ring
full toss outside leg stump this time and he just glances it away fine, three boundaries in a row and what a gem this is from Perera
clubbed down the the ground to long on, happy to feed Perera the strike. And why the heck not
clears the rope, was a short ball from round the wicket and Perera got underneath with his pull shot and had only had on intention for that ball: to put it into the stands
the carnage bus is in town, back over the wicket and it's full outside off, Perera has a swing of the arms and gets a thick edge to third man
short of a length, heaved through midwicket and fantastic hustle from Chandimal makes it into a second
picks out cover with a stinging drive...a foot either side and that was four more
short of a length outside off, clubbed to midwicket
full at the stumps, dug out into the leg side
round the wicket, slower ball, on a length, clubbed to cover
tucked off the stumps into midwicket, takes him to a breathtaking 23-ball fifty
good delivery, yorker (they still work), driven down to long off
round the wicket, another good full delivery which is just driven down the ground off the toe end
that's awesome power as he crunches a drive straight down the ground and it almost has enough to beat Jordan at long-off, but he does well with a dive
well bowled, full and it just dribbles into the off side
short of a length, he goes for the pull, lobs off the splice and Jordan takes the catch himself in the midwicket area

well bowled again, and it earns a run out! Full and fast at leg stump, jabbed back to the bowler. Prasanna thought it would bounce over Jordan and had already raced off for the run and it was a simple job for the bowler to remove the bails
full and straight, clubbed into the leg side...300 up for Sri Lanka
keeps it full at the stumps, worked to midwicket on the edge of the circle
full and straight, inside edge into the pad it bobbles to the off side

inn2.comm: around the wicket, Cook back, it skids on and there's a cry for lbw, it's going down
back again, this is nudged to point
fuller ball, forward blocking into the covers
a tad further outside off, pressing forward dropping this into the covers again
back playing into the covers
very full, punched down to long-off
back to cut, gets a thick outside edge and dropped at slip! It went very quickly to Jayawardene's left hand and he couldn't cling on, would have been a brilliant catch

goes back, this skids on, Moeen cuts, misses and is bowled! Dilshan strikes first up yet again and perhaps there most dangerous player is back in the shed first ball. No turn at all and Moeen has misjudged this completely and lost his off stump
pressing forward a long way outside off is beaten as it skids past the outside edge
straighter line and touched to midwicket
short and Hales manages to chop it down behind short third man for a couple
full on the off stump, blocked to extra-cover
this skids on too with Cook back, pressing back to the bowler from off stump
forward to a straighter ball, pushes up to the bowler's left hand
more air, big stride in and blocked up the wicket
straight delivery, well swept and well timed through backward square leg
forward just outside off playing to cover
back to cut and finds cover
a step down the track flicking back to the bowler
straighter ball flicked out to deep midwicket
forward dropping this from just outside off to backward point
more air, driven firmly back to the bowler but more of a thick bottom edge
even more air, just smothered and ran to cover
this skids on and takes the inside edge past Sangakkara and runs out towards the fine leg rope, a touch fortunate for Cook
waits for this in the crease and nudges out to deep midwicket
waits back and carves into the gap between backward point and short third man
straighter line and worked into midwicket, oh goodness they're coming back for two and it was good job for Cook the throw was wide or it could have been tight
back nudging to short extra-cover
hoho Cooky!! Slog swept from well outside off and nailed over deep midwicket, his tenth sixth in ODIs!
back now and cut only as far as backward point
a little straight and worked through square leg for a couple before deep midwicket can get around
back punching into the covers and Chandimal makes a very smart diving save
forward press just outside off and knocked to point
a later cut this time, finds short third man
fuller and just blocked back up the wicket
floated up and driven to short extra-cover
just short of a length on a fourth-stump line, pressed to cover
full and wide, it swings away a little and beats Hale's lavish cover drive
length ball at the pads, comes off the thigh guard wide of Sangakkara so they take a leg bye
good length just outside off, Cook playing from the crease drops this into the covers
this comes back a little at Cook who again from the crease angles to cover
fuller length, Cook almost caught out but keeps it out in front of off stump
full length on the stumps, turned with the angle to short long leg

down the track smashing high into the sky but doesn't get enough of it and finds long-on! Hales got it off the bottom of the bat, it went very high but a good five yards short of the boundary and it was solidly taken, England in trouble
floated up on off stump, driven down to long-off
back on the stumps flicking a straight ball out to deep midwicket
forward press just outside off, dropping this into the covers
quicker ball, Cook leans across and angles to backward point this time
good length at the off stump, a hint of away swing, Root defends hanging back in the crease
fuller and straighter, tickled down to long leg
forward press to a length ball a couple of inches outside off, pushes to cover
straighter line, defended in the crease up the wicket

fuller ball sliding across Cook who leans back to cut and edges wide of slip! More fortune for the England skipper, a thick outside edge wide of the keeper, slip was diving to his right but couldn't get a hand to it
back on the off stump, defended back up the wicket
tossed up just outside off, Root well forward pressing down to long-on
off stump again, Cook playing with the angle from around the wicket down to long-on
across his stumps, trying to flick to leg but can only fiddle this back to Dilshan
fuller, Root gets a good stride out to it and nudges down to long-on
straight line, Cook forward gets a inside edge into vacant midwicket
back and pulled, it wasn't that short, gets it wide of deep midwicket for a second
full and wide of off stump, Cook leans into a well-timed drive but can't beat point who saves on the bounce
another well-timed drive, this time not past mid-off
foot outside off angled across Cook who leaves it alone
slightly tighter line forces Cook to play and he gets an inside edge into his pad, hint of inswing there
short and wide but Cook leaning across to cut misses completely, didn't move his feet at all
back of a length, just outside off, Cook just running this down to third man
just outside off, cut at and gets a thick bottom edge on the bounce to slip
forward just outside off, dropped into the covers, they take a little single and there's overthrows as the throw from point sails wide of the back-up man
full on the stumps, dropped just wide enough of square leg for a single
a lean well outside off, pressed wide of cover and they get a sharp single
down the wicket, right to the pitch, driving nicely out to deep cover
back chopping this out to deep cover
back of a length just outside off stump, Cook back forcing out to deep cover
back of a length and pulled wide of deep square so they get a couple
full on the off stump, another hint of away movement, kept out on the front foot
good length on a fourth-stump line, pressed up to mid-off
fuller and straight and clipped out to deep square

full length sliding across the off stump, Cook drives at it and edges, well taken at slip! Jayawardene diving low to his left takes the catch but they will check upstairs. Absolutely no question of a clean catch, very well held and Cook, having had several near-misses, finally has to go with another stroke that he played without moving his feet, back goes the England captain without a big score once more
full length angled into the off stump, a gentle press out to deep cover
more of a good length, Taylor shuffles across to it and fiddles it down to third man
back dabbing into the covers, Root takes off for a sharp single but it's a nice bounce for Dilshan and had he found the non-striker's end stumps, Root was gone
fuller on a fourth-stump line, Taylor well forward in defence up the wicket
straighter line, Taylor well across the stumps to clip through square leg for a single
wider line and cracked down to third man, too close to the fielder for a second
length ball on the stumps, dropped wide of mid-on and they scuttle through for a sharp single

back of a length at the body, it bounces a little and Taylor tries to fend it off, taken by Sangakkara and it's given out! England in disarray now. A little bounce made it really uncomfortable for Taylor who tried to ride the delivery down the leg side but it got a bit big on him and he clearly gloves it behind, Rod Tucker gave it out straight away
full length just outside off and it's well left, it came back a little
wider line and more easy to leave this time
similar delivery and Morgan stays inside the line to leave once more
slightly tighter line and Morgan plays at this dabbing into the covers
full on off stump, driven to mid-off
driven into the pitch and it runs to point
that's a top shot, punches an on-drive straight down the ground. Played on the up.
back outside off stump, pushed into the covers
another princely on-drive by Root, moves acorss his crease and leans forward into the shot and you couldn't wish to see a better stroke
drops it in short, Root pulls in front of square
full delivery, hint of shape into Root, flicked off the stumps to deep square
round the wicket, good delivery, angles back into Morgan and beats him on the inside edge...ball didn't really get up
back of a length, defended to cover
fuller delivery, comes forward and drives into the covers where Thirimanne dives
over the wicket, short on middle and leg, pulled to deep square
flicked off his hip backward of square on the leg side
some slow turn outside off, Morgan has to stop his shot as he drives to cover
tossed up with more flight, driven down to long off
sharp turn into Root who plays it off the back foot into the off side
comes forward and pushes down the ground
well, there's the variation. It's a leg-break from Dilshan! And it certainly turned. Defended on the back foot
pushed into the leg side, Dilshan skips across himself to field
gets Morgan into a tangle straight away with a lively short ball as he saw Morgan using his feet...Morgan sparred at the ball and it skimmed over his top edge and helmet, also beating Sangakkara
tight run! Full on off, pushed into the leg side and he set off straight away. Jeevan Mendis with the run-out attempt from mid-on
defended to midwicket
appeal for lbw as Root plays across the line at a length delivery, it looked pretty high on first glance
flicked away from off stump to midwicket
comes forward into a full delivery outside off and drives to cover

England's slide continues! Massive appeal for lbw as Morgan sweeps a full delivery, given not out on the field and they call for the review. Looks pretty straight, is there an bottom edge? Decided there's no edge and that's crashing into middle and leg. Morgan has to go
played off the back foot to midwicket, Thirimanne again flinging himself across the field to save a single
pushed down the ground to long on
squares him up as he looks to play to leg, gets an outside edge into the covers. It was another leggie
pushed to midwicket
gets half forward, uncertainty was to which way Dilshan is turning it, defended
full at off stump, driven firmly back down the pitch where Mathews gets his right hand on it
takes the pad behind square on the leg side
short, angled down the leg side, rolls his wrists on a pull and finds long leg
driven to mid-off
full, angled in at leg stump, flicked out to deep midwicket
comes forward and defends square into the off side
flicked off his pads to square leg
tucks a short ball into the leg side and Buttler has to get a hustle on
nudged to midwicket
full and worked down the ground
slides down the leg side and that will be a wide
slightly short outside off, cut to backward point
driven down to long on
driven to the cover sweeper
short of a length on leg stump, tucked to deep square
width outside off, Root throws his hands through a square drive and it flies down to third man
defended into midwicket
neatly played off the back foot out to the cover sweeper
takes advantage of some more with and drives this through cover with the placement to beat the sweeper
full outside off, driven down the ground
full on middle and leg, defended
slog-sweeps from off stump but pings it straight to midwicket
whipped off the back foot to deep midwicket
floated up outside off, very loopy, very gentle, left alone and called wide
pushed out to deep cover
played back to the bowler
tossed up full outside off, slapped down to long off
held back a touch slower, driven square to point
shorter, it turns, driven down the ground
that was the google, spins into the pads and loops to the leg side
glances this one fine of the keeper towards the fine-leg boundary but Lakmal makes a good chase
driven off the back foot to the cover sweeper
forward and plays a gentle drive to deep cover
goes in the air over point as he opens the face on this drive, no great power so it falls well short of the sweeper
juicy full toss which he fetches through midwicket but doesn't quite have the placement to beat long on
pushed to backward point
close! Goes for a drive and gets a inside past the stumps and Sangakkara
full and eased down the ground
reverse sweeps a full delivery in front of square on the off side
comes forward and strokes this to deep point with an open face
plays the standing reverse sweep this time, the ball was skidding on around off stump so he had to watch it closely but he got enough bat on it to beat short third man
now that's power, short and wide from Mendis and Buttler cracks it off the back foot through cover and it beats the sweeper even though he didn't have that far to move...1000 ODI runs for Buttler
cut to the sweeper
staying quite short, rocks back on leg stump and drives through the covers
full, pushed into the leg side
forward and drives down the ground and that takes him to another fifty in what has been a super series
picked him out! Just as Buttler was getting going. Tried to clear the off side but the bat just turned in his hand and the ball sliced in the air to deep cover
defended on the back foot, needs to be careful for the one that slides on
tossed up, full toss, swung down the ground
driven to long off
plays against the spin, flicks from middle and off through the leg side
quicker and flatter around leg stump, worked to midwicket
fuller, on leg stump, takes the pad back to the bowler
full, driven back to the bowler
opens the face into the off side
outside leg stump, whipped to deep midwicket
nicely driven through the off side, Chandimal scampers around the boundary and pulls off a good save then his strong return has Root diving
pushed into the off side
finds the gap at cover as he drives to the sweeper and hobbles to the other end
defended to short cover
pushed down the ground to long on, Root has to step over the sprawling Prasanna to start off for the gentle run
driven to deep cover and the uncomfortable Root jogs through
tossed up, slog swept wide of deep midwicket, fielder comes around to slide and sa...oh dear, straight through him
back and dabbing into midwicket for a sharp single
floated right up, steadily driven down the ground to long-on
leg stump line, paddled in front of short long leg and they get a quick run
googly, strikes the pad with Woakes looking to play straight
floated up on the stumps, driven steadily back to the bowler
right back punching down to long-on
floated right up just outside off, driven carefully out to deep cover
more air, Root right out to meet it driving to deep cover
dragged down and Woakes is right back in his crease to pull in front of deep midwicket, lovely timing
not quite as short, Woakes is back pressing from off stump to extra-cover
back again clipping to midwicket
back in the crease to delicately late cut from just outside off, gets too much on it but still gets a single in front of short long leg
back and punching down to long-on
right across the stumps aiming to flick leg side, only finds square leg
reverse sweep off the stumps straight to short third man
a step down the wicket and then lean into a ball that was tried to be pushed through, gets it out to deep midwicket
touch short, back punching down to long-on
flowing cover drive finds the fielder in the off side ring
straighter line and this time flicked down to long-on
floated up just outside off, swept firmly out to deep midwicket
back exposing the stumps and cutting to deep cover
full length driven back up the wicket
gets the front leg out of the way of this drive and plays down to long-on
straight delivery swept to short long leg, only just got that otherwise it was trouble
a step down the wicket, just nudges back to the bowler
floated up, Root out to meet it on the full and sweeps to deep square
around the wicket, full length, Woakes clips back to the bowler
gets inside the line to paddle sweep off middle and leg, it runs fine of deep-backward square for a couple
back in the crease flicking out to deep midwicket
floated up just outside off, pressed down to long-on
down the wicket a step or two and working out to deep midwicket
back on the stumps to flick out to deep midwicket again
forward press from off stump to midwicket who dives and saves to his right but they get a single anyway
back turning this out through square leg
forward to a length ball just outside off, flicked down to long-on
full length just outside off, driven well wide of deep cover and they get back for a second
yorker just outside off, dug out towards point, they refuse the run, Dilshan throws the non-striker's stumps down and they get an overthrow on the ricochet
length just outside off, Woakes tries to run it down to third man and gets a thick edge that is well saved by Sangakkara diving to his right, saved maybe three
back of a length, Root rocks back to pull and finds midwicket
low full toss strikes the pad with Root looking to clip off side, they take a leg bye, that might have missed Root's thigh pad, he's now got a pain in the thigh to deal with
yorker just outside off, dug out to point
down the track, it was fired in a little, this is turned out to deep square
stays in the crease and beaten outside off, was there an edge? Sangakkara put it down
down the track and a lovely in-to-out drive over extra-cover, lovely batting, fifty stand up in 63 balls, lovely
back on the stumps and punched down to long-on
turns around to reverse sweep but mistimes it point from middle and leg
down the track and mistimes an attempted slap back down the ground, finds the bowler
full toss drifts down the leg side, must have been a flick of the pad on the way to Sangakkara
full length on the off stump, Woakes trying to go off side only finds mid-off
bumper right on line, Woakes goes to hook and misses
full toss flicked off the pads but only as far as deep square
low full toss on the stumps nicely timed wide of mid-on, staying deep in the crease is Root and it worked there
another very well-timed stroke, this time a pull but straight to deep square
down the wicket, bowler saw him coming and fired it at the leg stump, strikes the pad and runs back to the bowler
a big stride forward and clip out to long-on
leg side flick in front of deep square, they run hard and get back for the second, excellent running
this drifts into the thigh pad and runs to short long leg, no leg bye available although Root did come half way down and had to scamper back
this is further down the leg side and misses the batsman
leg side-ish again and flicked firmly out wide of short long leg, chase for deep square and they get back for the second

dance down the pitch, the bowler saw him, fired it right in the blockhole and clean him up! Woakes has played pretty well but now forced to try and raise the tempo, comes down and aims a drive into the off side, the quicker ball beat him and knocked out leg stump
huge swing and a miss from Root, nicely flighted and it spins away as Root aims over deep midwicket

and now he's given! Going for the reverse sweep, misses the full delivery, and Rod Tucker is quick to say that's out. England have their review so Root reckons he may as well use it, but that looks fairly straight. Only an edge would save him, but it wasn't an instant review from Root. And it's hitting middle half-way up. That ends a fine series for Root, one of the England players who can hold their head high
this is googly, or slider, outside off and Tredwell plays down the wrong line
tossed full and wide, lures him into a drive and he doesn't make contact
worked from outside off through midwicket
full and straight, gone! This was fired in full, struck Jordan on the front pad as his bat got stuck. Looked to be heading towards middle and leg
just clears mid-on, picks this up from off stump and clubs it with plenty of bottom hand
close! This one slides on from round the wicket, Tredwell moving to leg and cuts it off the stumps
swing and a miss outside off
played and a miss again, this time trying to cut
jeepers, he's connected with this one, swings it from outside off and clears long-on...very clean strike
forward and pushes into the covers
full, straight, patted into midwicket
driven out to the cover sweeper
slides past the outside edge
whipped into the leg side, midwicket can't quite stop it
played back to the bowler
full on the stumps, pushed to midwicket
defended to the off side
clubbed down to long on
round the wicket, full, pushed to the off side
turn! Gurney trapped playing off the back foot and gets a thick inside edge to leg side
gives himself a touch of room and drives back to Mahela
tucked into the leg side
heaves at a full ball and gets an inside edge into square leg
worked from outside off to long on

wide outside off, Tredwell swings at fresh air, Sangakkara takes off the bails and appeals. It goes upstairs. Don't think Tredwell raised his foot...well, he did, but he got it back in time. Swift work from Kumar.
another swing and a miss, this ball goes on with the air and actually ends up missing leg stump
short and cut through the off side
driven down the ground, just over mid-off, but doesn't have the legs to reach the rope
slapped down the ground to long off
round the wicket, takes the pad to the on side
tossed up slower and slower, pushed back to the bowler
uses his feet, the squeezes a full ball into the covers
there it is! The pair combine. Mahela and Kumar. Tredwell charges down the pitch, misses by a mile and Sangakkara completes the simple stumping. Plenty of smiles and hugs from the Sri Lanka players.
